intro: Drimia mzimvubuensis, commonly known as the Mzimvubu bulb, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its tuberous roots and strap-like leaves. The plant produces white or pale purple flowers in late winter to early spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
